question.title: What is the primary reason for discontinuing platelet antiaggregants before surgery?
question.description: According to the table 1, what is the perioperative risk associated with platelet antiaggregants that requires dosage adjustment?

option_a.title: Hypertension
option_a.description: Continuing platelet antiaggregants in patients with hypertension may lead to an increased risk of bleeding during surgery.

option_b.title: Hypoglycaemia
option_b.description: Platelet antiaggregants may cause hypoglycaemia, which can be a perioperative risk.

option_c.title: Haemorrhage
option_c.description: Haemorrhage is a perioperative risk associated with platelet antiaggregants, which require dosage adjustment.

option_d.title: Dyskalemia
option_d.description: Dyskalemia is a perioperative risk associated with diuretic therapy, not platelet antiaggregants.
